article: Sarah came running in. She shouted happily, "Look what I  _  ." She put a snake skin on the newspaper I was reading and it came so suddenly that it caused me to  _  . "Mom, look! Isn't it  _  ?" said my seven-year-old daughter. I  stared at  the snake skin and thought that it really wasn't pretty. Everything children see  for the first time  is full of beauty in their eyes; they see only  _  and excellence in the world until educated. "  _  did the snake do this?" Sarah asked. I tried to seize the  _  to teach my children that there was almost always something beyond the obvious. I wanted to tell them that there was something else going on  _  what they saw in front of them. "Snakes shed their skin because they need to renew themselves," I  _  . "Why do they have to renew themselves?" Sarah asked. My son Robert laughed and said, "Because they don't  _  what they are and they want to be someone else." I politely ignored him and said that by shedding skins, we could  _  the hidden reality. "We often need to shed our skin, those coatings that we  _  ourselves with," I said to my children, who listened very  _  , with their eyes wide open. "This snake  no longer  needs this skin. It is probably too hard for him, or he probably doesn't think he looks as  _  in it as he once did. It's like buying a new  _  ." I'm sure this explanation will not  _  the naturalists. But Sarah was getting to understand that renewal is part of  _  . She should learn from it what we need to keep and what we need to  throw away  .
